question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As of October 2023, the European United Left/Nordic Green Left (GUE/NGL), now known as "The Left" in the European Parliament, holds a relatively small proportion of seats compared to other political groups. In the 2019 European Parliamentary Elections, GUE/NGL secured 41 out of 705 seats, making it one of the smaller groups in the parliament.

The largest groups historically have been the European People's Party (EPP) and the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats (S&D), which held 182 and 154 seats respectively after the 2019 elections. Current opinion polls and political trends do not indicate a significant surge in support for GUE/NGL across the European Union member states.

Furthermore, recent political developments suggest a fragmentation of the political landscape, but there is no substantial evidence pointing towards GUE/NGL becoming the largest group. Such a shift would require unprecedented electoral gains in multiple countries, surpassing both mainstream center-right and center-left parties, as well as emerging political forces.

Given these factors, the probability of GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections is extremely low.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, the European United Left/Nordic Green Left (GUE/NGL) is one of the smaller political groups in the European Parliament. In the 2019 European Parliament elections, GUE/NGL secured 41 out of 751 seats, which is approximately 5.5% of the total. The largest groups were the European People's Party (EPP) and the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats (S&D), with 182 and 154 seats respectively.

Historically, the GUE/NGL has not been among the largest groups, and there are no significant indicators suggesting a dramatic increase in their support leading up to the 2024 elections. Current polls and political trends up to my knowledge cutoff do not show a surge for GUE/NGL that would position them to overtake the larger parties.

Major shifts in the European political landscape are possible but typically occur over longer periods or due to significant events, none of which have been indicated for GUE/NGL. Therefore, it is highly probable that GUE/NGL will not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections.

question.title: Will Austria qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Austria participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
Austria has had a mixed track record in the Eurovision Song Contest in recent years. Here's a brief overview:

- **2023**: Austria successfully qualified for the Grand Final with Teya & Salena's song "Who the Hell is Edgar?". The entry was well-received and showcased Austria's ability to present contemporary and engaging performances.
- **2022**: Austria did not qualify for the Grand Final. Their entry "Halo" by LUM!X feat. Pia Maria failed to advance from the semi-finals.
- **2021**: Similarly, Austria did not make it to the Grand Final with Vincent Bueno's "Amen".
- **2018**: Austria achieved significant success, finishing 3rd in the Grand Final with Cesár Sampson's "Nobody But You".

Factors to consider:

1. **Selection Process**: Austria often selects their entries through internal selection, which can yield both strong and weak entries. The quality of the artist and song chosen for 2024 will heavily influence their chances.

2. **Performance and Staging**: Effective staging and live performance can enhance a song's appeal. Austria has demonstrated the ability to deliver compelling performances when the staging concept aligns with the song.

3. **Competition**: The dynamics of the semi-final in which Austria is placed can affect their chances. A semi-final with fewer strong competitors increases the likelihood of qualification.

4. **Trends and Public Reception**: Musical trends and audience preferences play a role. If Austria's 2024 entry resonates with contemporary trends or stands out uniquely, it will have a better chance.

5. **As of October 2023**, there is no information on the artist or song Austria will send for Eurovision 2024.

Given the above, while there is uncertainty without knowing the specific entry, Austria has shown that they can qualify when they have a strong song and presentation. Therefore, there is a moderate to high chance they will qualify for the Grand Final in 2024.

question.title: Will Austria fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Austria participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As an informed and well-calibrated forecaster, I will assess the likelihood of Austria failing to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 based on the following factors:

1. **Historical Performance**: Austria has had mixed results in recent years at Eurovision.
   - *2023*: Austria qualified for the Grand Final with Teya & Salena's "Who the Hell Is Edgar?" and achieved a respectable placement.
   - *2022*: Austria did not qualify with LUM!X feat. Pia Maria's "Halo."
   - *2021*: Austria failed to qualify with Vincent Bueno's "Amen."
   - *2018*: Austria secured a strong 3rd place with Cesár Sampson's "Nobody But You."
   - This pattern shows that while Austria can produce strong entries, they also have years where they do not advance past the semi-finals.

2. **Current Entry Information**: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Austria has not announced their representative or song for Eurovision 2024. Without details on the artist or the song's appeal, it's challenging to gauge their potential success.

3. **Competition Level**: The Eurovision Song Contest is highly competitive, with many countries striving to secure a spot in the Grand Final. Typically, about 10 out of 17-18 countries from each semi-final qualify, giving an average qualification chance of around 58%.

4. **Voting Dynamics**: Austria does not have as extensive diaspora or neighborly voting advantages compared to some other countries. This can sometimes make it more challenging to secure sufficient televotes.

5. **Selection Process**: The method Austria uses to select their entry (national final vs. internal selection) can impact the quality and appeal of the chosen act. If they opt for an internal selection, they may have more control over selecting a song with broader appeal.

6. **Trends and Expectations**: Unless Austria selects a standout entry that resonates with both juries and the public, there's a moderate risk of not qualifying. However, their recent qualification in 2023 may indicate a positive trend.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, President Joe Biden has announced his intention to run for re-election in the 2024 U.S. presidential election. He is the incumbent president with substantial support within the Democratic Party, and there are no prominent Democratic challengers poised to contest his nomination significantly. However, considerations about his age are noteworthy. President Biden was born on November 20, 1942, which means he will be 81 years old during the 2024 election cycle. While there have been concerns raised about his age and potential health issues, there have been no official reports indicating any serious health problems that would impede his ability to campaign or serve. Historically, it's rare for incumbent presidents to drop out of a re-election race unless faced with significant personal, health, or political issues. An example is Lyndon B. Johnson in 1968, who chose not to seek re-election due to widespread opposition to the Vietnam War and declining popularity. Given the lack of substantial evidence suggesting that President Biden will drop out, but acknowledging the uncertainties related to his age and unforeseen health issues or personal reasons, there's a low but non-negligible chance that he might withdraw before July 20, 2024.

question.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, President Joe Biden has declared his intention to run for re-election in 2024. While there have been concerns about his age—he would be 82 at the start of a potential second term—there are no significant indications that he plans to withdraw from the race. Incumbent presidents rarely drop out of re-election campaigns unless faced with major health issues or significant political scandals. There have been no reports of severe health problems or scandals that would compel Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024. Additionally, the Democratic Party largely supports his candidacy, and no prominent challengers have emerged to contest his nomination. Considering these factors, it is highly likely that Biden will continue his campaign past July 20, 2024.
